data.title: How to webcast using Microsoft Expression Encoder
data.text:
Step 1: Download & Install the 'Microsoft Expression Encoder' Software

Using Microsoft Expression Encoder you can capture audio/video from any device connected to your computer and broadcast it live using your ChristianWorldMedia.com streaming account. Click here to download Microsoft Expression Encoder..

Once you have installed Microsoft Expression Encoder, connect your video source (e.g. webcam) to the computer and launch Microsoft Expression Encoder.

Step 2: Setup your stream settings

To start streaming your video and/or audio source, please follow these steps. When you first start Microsoft Expression Encoder you may be asked to choose a project type. Choose the Live Broadcasting Project option.

Select the 'Add a Live Source' link.

Choose your 'Video Device'.

Choose your 'Audio Device'.

Select the 'Output' menu tab.

Check the 'Streaming' checkbox.

Check the 'Publishing Point' checkbox.

Enter your Publishing Point URL in the 'Location' field. You can find your Publishing Point URL by logging into your account and selecting the "Stream Settings" menu option.

Press 'Connect'. You will be prompted to enter your publishing username and password. This may be different then the username and password you use to login to your account. You can find your publishing username and password by logging into your account and choosing the "Stream Settings" menu option.

When you have successfully connected to the server you will see a "connected" message appear on the right of the button.

If a connection was NOT established you will see an error message.

Press the 'Cue' button from your live source. At this point you should be able to see your live video feed.

Press the 'Start' button to begin broadcasting.

Step 3: Watch your live stream!

To watch your live stream open your favorite internet browser and visit the channel url assigned to your account. You can find your url (and many other options to viewing your stream) by logging into your account and choosing the "Stream Settings" menu option.
